section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: A hands-on programming section where students will learn the fundamental building blocks of Python programming: variables and data types. Through practical exercises, students will gain proficiency in creating, manipulating, and understanding different types of data.
learning_objectives: Define and assign values to variables using proper Python syntax.
Identify and use core data types including integers, floats, strings, and booleans.
Convert data between different types using type casting functions.
Apply knowledge of variables and data types to solve basic programming problems.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create variables, assign values, and print their contents to the console.
key_topics: Variable assignment syntax using the equals sign (=)
Naming conventions and rules for variables
The print() function for displaying variable values

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables: one for your name, one for your age, and one for your favorite color. Print each variable's value to the console.
Create a variable called 'score' and assign it the value 10. Print the score. Then, reassign the variable to 15 and print the new value.

lessons.lesson_title: Working with Numeric and Boolean Data
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform basic arithmetic operations with integers and floats and use boolean values in simple logical expressions.
key_topics: Comparison operators (==, >, <) and their boolean results

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create two variables with numeric values. Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division on these variables, printing each result.
Compare two numbers using the greater than (>) and equality (==) operators. Store the results in variables and print them to see the boolean outcome.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create, concatenate, and access basic properties of string data.
key_topics: Defining strings with single and double quotes
String concatenation using the plus (+) operator
Using the len() function to find string length

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for a greeting (e.g., 'Hello') and a name. Concatenate them into a full greeting and print it. Also, print the length of the full greeting.
Ask the user to input a word. Print the first character and the last character of the word using indexing.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert data between strings, integers, and floats using type casting functions.
key_topics: The str(), int(), and float() functions
When and why type conversion is necessary
Handling errors from invalid conversions (e.g., converting 'hello' to an integer)

exercises.exercise_instructions: Ask the user for their age as a string. Convert it to an integer, calculate their approximate age in days (age * 365), and print the result as part of a full sentence string.
Create a variable with the value '123.45'. Convert it to a float, then convert that float to an integer. Print both the float and integer values and observe the difference.

lessons.lesson_title: Putting It All Together: A Mini-Project
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to combine variables, different data types, and type conversion to create a simple, interactive program.
key_topics: Combining multiple concepts in a single script
Using input() to get user data
Planning and writing a multi-step program

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that asks the user for their name, age, and favorite food. Use these inputs to create and print a short, personalized story that incorporates all the information.
